change.item: Finding aid revised and edited by Zoe Blecher-Cohen, Mandy Abokhair, and Aileen Thong in 2021 to update the institutional change from NYU-Poly to NYU and for compliance with DACS Required Elements for Archival Description.

repository.corpname: Poly Archives at the Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology, NYU Libraries

did.physloc: Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology 5 MetroTech Center Brooklyn, New York, 11201 (646) 997-3943 polyarchives@nyu.edu

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Polytechnic University in all its forms are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Poly Archives. Please contact the Poly Archives, polyarchives@nyu.edu, 646-997-3530.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Poly Archives Serial Publications Collection; RG 030; box number; folder number or item identifier; Poly Archives at Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology, New York University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series are arranged alphabetically by publication title.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The serial publications in this collection were loosely grouped together in the archives in the mid 2000s. Historical notes at the series level provide an explanation of each publication in this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The publications in this collection include newsletters, bulletins, newspapers, department news, yearbooks, alumni magazines and literary journals. Collectively, these publications produced by Polytechnic students, faculty, alumni, and the administration, cover over 100 years of research, innovation, and campus life.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Bohican was the student newspaper for the Farmingdale campus.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Cable replaced Polygraphs as the alumni magazine in 1973. It is still published today.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Counterweight Quarterly was the student literary magazine from 1957-2002.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Feedback was a publication of the undergraduate Electrical Engineering department during the 1960s. In 2002, Feedback was resurrected as "IEEE Feedback, The Poly Magazine for Student Research & Much More..." sponsored by the Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE) Department with contributions by ECE and IEEE students.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Fusion was a student newspaper owned and published by Polytechnic University. Fusion's office was on the Farmingdale campus and the paper was distributed to both Long Island and Brooklyn campuses. All Poly students were invited to submit articles for publication through the Farmingdale Student Life office or to become a member of the Fusion staff.

Fusion was re-inaugurated in 2004 as a magazine staffed by students of Polytechnic University and funded by the Department of Technical Communications. The new iteration of the magazine focused on engineering and technology articles as well as social issues important to engineering students and professionals.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Golana was a science fiction magazine produced by the students of Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn. The magazine included original artwork, fiction, and poetry.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Imaging Quarterly was a publication of the newly formed Institute of Imaging Sciences at the Polytechnic Institute of New York.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: News @ Poly was a publication of the Polytechnic University Public Affairs Department.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Phoenix was a literary magazine by and for Polytechnic students. The magazine included original poetry, prose, photographs, and drawings.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Poly Men was the former alumni publication of the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn. Founded in 1921, the members of the Alumni Association unanimously agreed to adopt Trustee J. Monroe Hewlett's suggestion of "Poly Men" as the publication's name. Poly Men was later superceded by Polygraphs (1970 - 1979) and Cable Magazine (1973 - present).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged chronologically by format, with bound volumes following loose issues in boxes and folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Not duplicates; numbering repeats with new content.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Poly Tatler was a periodical of campus news, letters, editorials, and fiction.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by complete issues and then notes/documentation corresponding to these issues.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Polygraphs (1970-1979) was an alumni newsletter produced by the Brooklyn Polytechnic Alumni Association.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Polytechnic Engineer was a technical magazine, founded in 1898, for undergraduate students at Polytechnic. The magazine included student articles on engineering and science as well as current research at the school. The publication lay dormant for forty years, when it was resurrected in 1960 with a new volume 1.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged chronologically by format, with bound volumes following loose issues in boxes and folders.

did.unittitle: Survey of Engineering College Student Magazines- referencing Polytechnic Engineering

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Polytechnic News bulletin underwent slight title and audience changes over the years, but remained a widely distributed source of information about faculty research and happenings around Polytechnic. From 1955-1956 the bulletins were titled "Report from Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn." In 1957, the headline changed to "News from Polytechnic: A newsletter for the faculty in staff." In 1970, this title was tweaked to "The Polytechnic Faculty News: For faculty and staff of the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn." In 1974, the title changed to "Polytechnic News: A Newsletter of Polytechnic Institute of New York," which indicated both the university's name change and, no longer specifying faculty as the only audience, a wider distribution. In 1984 the title became "Poly News: Polytechnic Institute of New York - Newsletter - Brooklyn - Long island - Westchester." Finally, in 1986, reflecting yet another name change to the university, the title changed to "Poly News: Polytechnic University - Newsletter - Brooklyn - Long island - Westchester."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged chronologically, with all name variations grouped together under the general series title "Polytechnic News." Bound volumes follow loose issues in boxes and folders.

did.unittitle: Report from the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn, Volume 1, No. 1-5
Report from the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn, Volume 2, No. 1-2

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Polytechnic was the student newspaper for the evening students of the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged chronologically by format, with bound volumes following loose issues in boxes and folders.

did.unittitle: Series XVI: Polywog, Innovations, and Legacy

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Polywog was Polytechnic's yearbook for the Brooklyn campus (1887 - 2009). Innovations (1986-1993) and Legacy (1994-2002) were yearbooks published by Polytechnic's Long Island campus.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged chronologically by format, with bound volumes following loose issues in boxes and folders.

did.unittitle: Series XVII: The Poly Prep and Polyglot

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Poly Prep and Polyglot are publications of Poly Prep Country Day School after Brooklyn Collegiate and Polytechnic Institute separated into two schools. Poly Prep moved to Bay Ridge and continued on as a prep school for boys, whereas the collegiate part of the institution became Brooklyn Polytechnic Institute, the precursor to today's NYU Polytechnic School of Engineering.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Polytechnic was a periodical of campus news, letters, editorials, and fiction, 1890-1906.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged chronologically by format, with bound volumes following loose issues in boxes and folders.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Polytechnic Reporter is the student newspaper of the Brooklyn campus (1914 - present).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The following items represent bound volumes of the Polytechnic Reporter. Loose issues of the Polytechnic Reporter in box/folder arrangement are in The Polytechnic Reporter Collection, RG025.

did.unittitle: Series XX: Various small run publications
Bits and Bytes-- Information Services Department
